title: [Neuroscience] Researchers have discovered that spontaneous impulses of dopamine, the neurological messenger known as the brain's 'feel good' chemical, occur in the brain of mice. The study also found that mice can willfully manipulate these random dopamine pulses for reward.
[Neuroscience] Our ability to perceive, learn and interact with others depends on our brain’s capacity to track the uncertainty or ‘precision’ of our minds
